That easy problem was trivial! You didn't even break a sweat, after all, you know Prim's algorithm and stuff. Now, as you're sitting in 2406 listening to Prof McKenney talk about his LotR collection, you think of another number, 1000 digits long. You notice that four adjacent digits in this number create a really big product. The sequence is 9989, which gives 9 × 9 × 8 × 9 = 5832. That's almost as big as it can be!

Impressed with yourself, you see what the largest product you can create from any 5 adjacent digits (40824), then 8 adjacent digits (7838208). As you get to 13 digits, it gets harder. You're not sure what the greatest product is, so you make a program to do it. What is the value of this product?

<p class="monospace center">
